description: Erection of an end of terrace two-bedroom house with associated parking and landscaping.
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - The proposed development shall be carried out in all respects in accordance with the proposals contained in the application and the plans submitted (Design and Access Statement. Received 05/09/2016. Energy Statement. Received 27/09/2016. 2PC/25072016/REV-D-1, 2PC/25072016/REV-D-2, Energy letter. Received 25/10/2016) therewith and approved by the Local Planning Authority, or as shall have been otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority before the building is used.

Condition : 3 - No additional windows or other glazed openings shall be formed in the side walls of the building hereby approved and no additional doors inserted in the building without the prior written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Notwithstanding the provisions of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development Order) 1995 (or any order revoking or re-enacting that order) no enlargement of the premises or any additional structures/buildings within the curtilage of the site shall be carried out.

Condition : 5 - The garage or car parking accommodation shown on drawing No. 2PC/25072016/REV-D-2 shall be provided before the dwelling to which it relates is occupied and thereafter it shall not be used for any purpose other than the parking of vehicles.

Condition : 6 - No development shall take place until samples of the materials to be used in the construction of the external surfaces of the hereby permitted have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details

Condition : 7 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and as-built certificates under the Standard Assessment Procedure) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved revisions.

Condition : 8 - (i) No development shall take place until the details of a Sustainable Urban Drainage scheme (SUDs), including measures for (i) the harvesting of rainwater, (ii) the minimisation of water run-off from the site, aiming for greenfield levels, and (iii) the conservation and reuse as appropriate of other water supplies in the buildings have been submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.
(ii) The building(s) shall not be occupied until evidence (e.g. photographs and copies of installation contracts) has been submitted to the Local Planning Authority to demonstrate that the development has been carried out in accordance with the approved details.

Condition : 9 - Prior to first occupation of the building( evidence (schedule of fittings and manufactures literature) shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved internal water use calculations.

Condition : 10 - Prior to first occupation of the building, evidence shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the required sustainable materials:
(i) At least three of the key elements of the building envelope (external walls, windows roof, upper floor slabs, internal walls, floor finishes/coverings) achieve a rating of A+ to D in the Building Research Establishment (BRE) The Green Guide of specification.
(ii) At least 50% of timber and timber products are sourced from accredited Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) or Programme for the Endorsement of Forestry Certification (PEFC) schemes
(iii) No construction or insulation materials have been used which will release toxins into the internal and external environment, including those that deplete stratospheric ozone.

Condition : 12 - The dwarf wall referred to in approved drawing 2PC/25072016/REV-D-2 shall be constructed before the development is first occupied and permanently retained thereafter and it shall have an opening to allow access for pedestrians and vehicles no wider than the existing drop kerb.  Within a triangular area 2.4 metres wide and 2.4 metres deep either side of the access so formed, there shall be no obstructions higher than 60 mm above ground level

Condition : 13 - In the front garden the developer shall provide two wheeled refuse bin stores prior to first occupation of the new house - one in each of the following two locations: adjacent to the boundary with 69 Park Road; and adjacent to the west boundary close to the westernmost corner of the approved house.  The stores shall be in pressure treated timber and fully enclosed on all four sides, with a roof and hinged front doors.  Each shall measure128 cm high, 156 cm wide and 82cm deep.  The proposed bicycle storage shown on the approved plan shall be in materials and to a design that shall first be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority under Condition 6 of this permission.
